list_definition.definition: (with to) having reason to be grateful to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I am indebted to you for your help.

list_ex_of_english: We are also indebted to the families who kindly provided information during the interviews.
The changed attitude to film and memory was substantially indebted to these programs.
All students of early modern and of women's history will be indebted to her fastidious unravelling of the commonplace view of women.
They are also most indebted to two referees for their valuable comments.
The author is indebted to a referee for some detailed comments on an earlier form of this paper and for some additional references.
They also make explicit a function of civility: to thank the people one is indebted to.
We are especially indebted to the users who volunteered some of their time to provide us with valuable comments on functionalities and user interface design.
The authors are indebted to a reviewer for calling this reference to their attention.
